bibl.title: Teramoto Sadashige v. T.W. Lynch. Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of TERAMOTO SADASHIGE for a writ of habeas corpus
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington.

Now comes the respondent, T.W. Lynch, Acting United States Commissioner of Immigration, for the District of Washington, with headquarters at the port of Seattle, Washington, and for answer to the writ of habeas corpus in the above entitled matter, says that he here produces the said TERAMOTO SADASHIGE, the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction thereof; and for further return and answer to said writ avers that he is detaining in his custody the said TERAMOTO SADASHIGE for deportation from the United States, as an alien Japanese person not entitled to admission under the laws of the United States, under and by virtue of an order of the Secretary of Labor of the United States, issued to him, the said respondent, said order being in the words and figures following, to wit:
Submitted with letter of Commissioner at Seattle, Brief of Atty., Board Minutes, etc.

Whatever domicile this alien had in the United States was illegal, he having first entered in violation of law, without the inspection required under the Immigration Act and was not then in possession of a proper passport. The fact that he is now returning to the United States to resume his domicile does not entitle him to consideration. He is now without a proper passport, does not appear upon the manifest of the vessel as a seaman, but is reported as a stowaway.
The Bureau concurs in the recommendation that he be EXCLUDED.

Respondent attaches hereto the original record, decision and exhibits, both on the hearing before the board of special inquiry at Seattle, Washington, and the hearing on appeal to the Secretary of Labor, which papers constitute a part of this return.
And now the respondent having fully answered, prays that said writ may be discharged.
Acting United States Commissioner of Immigration.
T.W. Lynch, being first duly sworn, on his oath deposes and says:
That he is the acting commissioner of immigration named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return and knows the contents thereof; and that he believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 10th day of November, 1921.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Teramoto Sadashige for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed in the United States District Court
